channel.title: Ubuntu 12.04
channel.description: I recently upgraded from 11.10 to 12.04 Ubuntu, and found that this version is extremely buggy for me, there is always system issues, and I can't even restart because it won't end correctly, does anyone else experience issues with the newest upgrade? Or is it just me?

item.title: Ubuntu 12.04
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Well the second I upgraded, I was attacked by the “A program wants access to your default keyring message”
Every time I entered my password, it would just ask again… Its always coming up saying “There is a system error” and such… Might just have been corrupted in the installation…

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 12.04
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I installed it on my desktop now, and I must say that I have to get used to it. I don’t really like it that the loader doesn’t go away.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 12.04
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

what CPU/Ram specs do the laptops have? I only have an n450 atom with 1gb ram

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 12.04
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I upgraded to 12.04 on 2 desktops and 2 laptops, no problems on any of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 12.04
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Classic, post:6, topic:450307”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=553201.msg4055163#msg4055163 date=1342872918]

upgrades generally break your system

True for me. Both my desktop and laptop run Ubuntu as dual boot. I tried to update both (not to 12.04), and both got stuck while updating. In the end, I had to do a hard reboot. Both still work, but I get a lot of errors. On my desktop, the package manager doesn’t even work.
[/quote]
then shouldn’t you be reinstalling the os about now?[/quote]

Yea, but I can’t be bothered at the moment. I don’t use the desktop that much, and my laptop is still usable. I’ll make a new live cd this week though.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 12.04
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:5, topic:450307”][quote author=t4 link=topic=553201.msg4053372#msg4053372 date=1342725517]
upgrades generally break your system
[/quote]

True for me. Both my desktop and laptop run Ubuntu as dual boot. I tried to update both (not to 12.04), and both got stuck while updating. In the end, I had to do a hard reboot. Both still work, but I get a lot of errors. On my desktop, the package manager doesn’t even work.[/quote]
then shouldn’t you be reinstalling the os about now?

Read full topic

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

t4:

upgrades generally break your system

True for me. Both my desktop and laptop run Ubuntu as dual boot. I tried to update both (not to 12.04), and both got stuck while updating. In the end, I had to do a hard reboot. Both still work, but I get a lot of errors. On my desktop, the package manager doesn’t even work.
